abstract.p: New study commissioned by Britain's Department of Trade and Industry to measure safety of hands-free devices for mobile telephones determines that devices pose less risk to consumers by offering substantial reductions in radiation exposure compared with that of regular hand-held mobile phones (S)

block.p: A new study commissioned by Britain's Department of Trade and Industry to measure the safety of hands-free devices for mobile telephones determined that the devices pose less risk to consumers by offering substantial reductions in radiation exposure compared with that of regular hand-held mobile phones. The new study conflicted with one by Britain's Consumers Association, which reported that hands-free devices exposed consumers to more radiation. Britain is one of the biggest markets for mobile telephones.
